data.title: dance recital
data.text: very nice venue and parking was easy.   $5 across the street from center.  Was dark when program was over but area was well lit

data.title: Family friendly
data.text: The Cannon Center is family friendly and also handicap accessible.  The music was wonderful, great sound.  Easy to get in and out of. Parking is not bad, but you do have to walk.

data.title: Super Symphony
data.text: We take the kids to the Memphis Symphony Holiday event.  We think the Cannon Center is a wonderful venue.  We've never had bad seats and you can get in and out fairly easily.  The venue is clean and relatively new, so that is nice too.

data.title: Concerts and Contests During Elvis Week 2016
data.text:
Great venue!  Excellent staff, great acoustics and lighting, very nice theatre.

Went there for the Images of the King Finals and concert starring Dwight Icenhour, Ben Portsmouth (did not like how Ben wanted the lights so low that he could not be seen), Jay Dupuis and Dean Z.   Great concert except for Ben and the lighting.

data.title: "SUNSET WAS THE STAR"
data.text: We went for the Clean Comedy Experience. . . What a show! ...funny with no cursing!  The staff was amazing.  They reseated a disabled Friend of ours.  Maggie was great. I had been rushing around well she even brought me a fan! Great venue. I'll return soon for another show.  A must do when you are in MEMPHIS!

data.title: Excellent accoustics!
data.text: We have attended numerous concerts in this venue.  There is no such thing as a bad seat! All are good. Accoustics are wonderful.  My husband and I have been in the audience and on stage. This is an excellent venue for the performing arts.

data.title: Wonderful acoustics no matter where you sit.
data.text: The best acoustics no matter where you sit.  Easy parking and getting in and out of the area.  Volunteers are every where to point you to the right direction.

data.title: Very cozy atmosphere for a Concert - made you feel like you were up close and personal
data.text: Loved the concerts I have attended here.  There is a wonderful atmosphere and cozy feel to the venue that makes you feel like you are attending a very personal concert.  If you get the chance, you should definitely go!

data.title: Top Notch Facility
data.text: The facility is state of the art with a excellent sound system, seating and access. There is not a bad seat in the house, in addition, underground parking is available so you can avoid the elements.

data.title: Fun!
data.text: Had a great time here going to see the Dancing Dolls on the Bring IT live tour. The ladies showing everyone where to sit were friendly.

data.title: Great
data.text: My daughter had her 2016 graduation commencement here and it was great, not enough good parking but clean and great.

data.title: Excelent venue
data.text: the Cannon Center is built for sound. This is the perfect comfortable space to listen to an orchestra or even a small ensemble. Acoustics are excellent and seating is comfortable. What more could you want?

data.title: Children ruined my experience
data.text: I saw the Christmas concert, which was good, but a child in my row kept kicking the wall in front of us and rocking the seats continuously.

data.title: Handel's Messiah
data.text: My first visit to the remodeled Cannon Center. The place was very comfortable and inviting. Parking at the Mud Island lot was convenient. The performance was quite good especially given that it was a semi-professional group.

data.title: Fantastic performance space!
data.text: Come hear the Memphis Symphony perform in this beautiful concert hall downtown.  There are many restaurants nearby on Second Street.

data.title: Diane Reeves Concert
data.text: I attended a Diane Reeves concert recently, and was amazed by the customer service and the quality of the venue

data.title: Elvis Pops Concert with Terry Mike is GREAT....dancers not so much!!!
data.text: We have been attending the Memphis Symphony Orchestra Elvis Pops Concert for many years.  The Terry Mike Jeffrey band performs this concert with the symphony and it is always one of our favorites.  Terry Mike sounds so much like Elvis, but does not try to look like him.  His wife, Debbie, and son, Adam, are also in the band.  This year (2016) someone with the Cannon Center or the symphony had this idea about inviting some dancers to dance in front the band.  They were just awful and were a huge distraction.  This concert is about Elvis' music and Terry Mike delivers it better than anyone else.  The concert does not need distractions!!!  Please don't have those dancers again!

data.title: Nice place to hold  Tenn Treble Honor Choir.
data.text: My daughter was picked along with several other hundred kids in Tennessee to come here and have a two day honor choir camp and then preform that last day.  The guy they brought in to teach them was great. This place is huge and I know it is at least two stories, has escalators to take you up and down. Right down town with many things to do within walking distance.

data.title: Saw the Memphis Blues awards at the Cannon.
data.text: It was about a month ago and it was a really big deal for Memphis. Justin Timberlake and Sam from Sam and Dave were honored.It was a night full of great music and the Cannon Center is one of two perfectly designed concert halls in Memphis. The acoustics are PERFECT (the other is the Germantown Performing Arts Center). Parking is available across the street on Front.

data.title: Fantastic Experience for All Ages
data.text:
I am going to become a regular at the Cannon Center. This was my first time going to see a symphony perform and the whole time I was kicking myself for not taking advantage of this wonderful arts venue since moving to Memphis. The acoustics are marvelous and the Memphis Symphony did not disappoint. 

Tips: 
Worried about not dressing classy enough to go to the symphony? Don't. I saw all walks of life wearing all sorts of clothing ranging from students in jeans to grown folks in evening wear.

There are several levels of seating with elevators and stairs. We took a group of orchestra students and balcony tickets were $5 each for them.

You can purchase tickets in advance or at the Cannon Center. I imagine extremely popular performance tickets sell out quickly. 

90 minutes before show time, the Memphis Symphony offers a "talk" about the music. 

There are cocktails for purchase on the ground level.
